Description: The United States is ending support for F-16 fighters transferred to Ukraine, - Forbes The administration of US President Donald Trump has stopped supporting F-16 fighters transferred to Ukraine, including the supply of vital components for electronic warfare systems. Before being sent to Ukraine, F-16 fighters were equipped with electronic warfare systems, including AN/ALQ-131 suspended containers and PIDS+ and ECIPS+ systems. The cessation of supplies of spare parts and software for these systems significantly reduces the combat capabilities of Ukrainian aircraft, says Forbes analysts.In response to this situation, Ukraine is looking for alternative solutions. France has expressed its readiness to provide Dassault Mirage 2000 fighters equipped with its own electronic warfare systems, independent of American support. These aircraft can partially compensate for the loss of combat capabilities of the F-16. Earlier, in August 2024, the White House refused to send American specialists to maintain the F-16 in Ukraine for security reasons, fearing a possible escalation of the conflict.

Description: Romanian presidential candidates accused of having ties to Russia were allowed to participate in the electionsRomania's Constitutional Court rejected protests against the registration of far-right candidate Calin Georgescu in the upcoming presidential elections scheduled for May 4, reportedon the institution's website. This decision allows Georgescu to participate in the elections, subject to the approval of his candidacy by the Central Electoral Bureau.CƒÉlin Georgescu, known for his far-right and pro-Russian views, unexpectedly led in the first round of the November 2024 presidential election with 22.94% of the vote. However, the results of this round were annulled by the Constitutional Court in December 2024 due to suspicions of Russian interference in the electoral process. This decision caused mass protests by Georgescu's supporters, who accused the authorities of undermining democracy. In February 2025, a criminal case was opened against Georgescu on charges of creating a fascist organization, disseminating false information and undermining the constitutional order. On February 26, he was detained by police on his way to submit documents to register for the repeat elections. Despite this, on March 7, Georgescu filed his candidacy for the upcoming elections, collecting more than 324,000 signatures in his support. The Constitutional Court decision on March 8 clears the way for Georgescu to participate in the elections on May 4, if his candidacy is approved by the Central Electoral Bureau. However, his participation remains in doubt due to the ongoing criminal investigation and preventive measures imposed against him, including a ban on leaving the country and publishing xenophobic content on the Internet. The political crisis in Romania intensified after the resignation of President Klaus Iohannis on February 10, 2025. Iohannis resigned to avoid impeachment proceedings initiated by the opposition after the election results were annulled. Senate President Ilie Bolojan was appointed acting president.

Title: üñº 2025 will be the last year of legal operation of most aircraft...
Description: 2025 will be the last year of legal operation of most aircraft in the Russian aircraft fleetEquipment failures in Russian aircraft are becoming more and more frequent. Thus, from December 1, 2024 to January 20, 2025, aircraft from the Russian fleet experienced 11 engine failures. It was previously reported that last year the number of air incidents in the Russian Federation increased by 25%. At least 90% of these were due to system failures, mainly engines and chassis. If the West does not lift sanctions, the situation will worsen this year, experts are sure, interviewed Radio Liberty. Vessels require a thorough inspection - C Check - every 18-24 months, and D Check - every 6-12 years. This cannot be done without direct cooperation with aircraft manufacturers. -I don‚Äôt have exact data on the service life of all Russian aircraft, but 2025 will be the last year of legal operation of most of them,- said a Russian aviation safety expert.Russian airlines are trying to extend the life of aircraft by smuggling certified parts from the US and Europe, as well as resorting to unofficial technical inspections and reducing the frequency of flights. Today, the Russian aircraft fleet consists of about 700 foreign and 150 Sukhoi Superjet. However, sanctions also affect the production of domestic aircraft, since they also depend on Western parts. Even though they can pass C and D Check in the Russian Federation, airlines will still have to resort to finding Western parts for modernization. -Both foreign aircraft and the Superjet will eventually be taken out of service due to parts shortages. Superjet will last only a year longer,- another flight safety expert told the publication.Russia is pinning its hopes on the new domestic MC-21 aircraft, but the Russian Federation does not have a replacement for American engines. If China can supply Russia with reliable engines, the MC-21 may have a future, but not before 2029, experts say. -As a result, China will receive a plane for rogue countries - Iran, North Korea and Russia,- one of the interlocutors concluded.
